intro: Psammophiliella tubulosa, commonly known as the desert sandflower, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that bloom in shades of red and purple. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is adapted to survive in extreme drought conditions. Its leaves are reduced to small scales, minimizing water loss, while its stems are succulent, storing moisture. Psammophiliella tubulosa plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing nectar for pollinators in its native habitat.
